subject: RE: [junit] question regarding setup()
msgSnippet: ... boolean ... But why? Why not just put that stuff in the constructor? If it s expensive configuration that only needs to be performed once, why not do it in
messageBody:
--- sachin gupta <sachin@...> wrote:
>One easy way to achieve this is to define a boolean with initial value

>true. You can set this boolean to false during your first run of
> setup() and you only execute statements inside setup() if this
boolean
> is true :)

But why?

Why not just put that stuff in the constructor?

If it's expensive configuration that only needs to be performed once,
why not do it in a decorator (specifically,
junit.extensions.TestSetup)?

Regards,

Rob
